review_title: Toxic work culture, limited pay and benefits
pros: At one time it was a decent place to work with people who had passion for students.
cons: In the past 10 years Wesleyan has become more of a toxic work environment. Because of dismal pay, staff and faculty who once had passion for the institution, have had no choice but to leave, and slowly being replaced by those who do minimal work for a small paycheck. Administration puts their head in the sand and ignores the real issues of the institution and continues to tell you to do less with more, and ignore actions of poor leadership. There is no tolerance for change, innovation, or creativity. Even with those who want to make Wesleyan a better place, they are met with harsh no's and a get back in line mentality.

review_title: Nice Small Liberal Arts College, Please Improve Compensation to Retain Employees Long Term
pros:
*Great colleagues
*Long vacations around Christmas and also Summer
*Low cost meals for Faculty/Staff in cafeteria
*Free tuition for employees/family members
*Tuition Exchange program member
*Good entry level college teaching job
cons:
*Poor compensation. The low salary at Tennessee Wesleyan is depressing. I have worked 10 years here, and I know of new faculty hires that have been offered comparable and even higher salaries than mine.
*Bad place to stay long term due to salary lagging far behind inflation.

review_title: Little room for growth and a toxic environment that can cause extreme stress
pros: More vacation time than most jobs
cons:
Poor leadership across campus 
No professional development opportunities
No support from supervisors - "sink or swim" environment
Pay is less than all peer institutions
Promotions given based on who you know and not experience based

review_title: A potentially great place to work, under new leadership
pros: The TWC community is very close-knit, and operates at a slow pace.  Employees' vacation days are scheduled around the academic calendar, so there are paid vacations days such as Fall Break, Easter, and Spring Break.
cons: The lack of structure at the college is the downfall of this institution. There are lots of policies that are absent in different departments, which often leads to confusion between departments. Although the community is very close-knit, the majority of the staff as former TWC alums or people who have been with that institution for many years.  There is a lack of willingness to change, or embrace new ideas, that may help advance the college. The business systems are antiquated, which causes many financial errors.

review_title: Not an environment for out of the box thinkers or creatives
pros: Flexible time off, more holidays, food discount,  community feel
cons: This is a place where people who just want to get a paycheck thrive.  Keep your head down and you have a job for life.  Systems encourage mediocrity, pay is well below average, new responsibilities constantly added with no boost in pay or plans for adding new employees.
